title: Recipe Exchange: Cocoa chip, chocolate chip and peanut butter cookies
text:
LOOKING FOR
FOUND
Janet Johnson of Pennsburg sent in several cookie recipes for Joyce Kurtz of Slatington. The Cocoa Chip Cookie recipe is from the "Hershey's Cocoa Cookbook." The Chocolate Chip Cookie and Peanut Butter Cookie recipes are from "Betty Crocker's Cooky Book."
COCOA CHIP COOKIES
2/3 cup shortening
1 1/2 cups sugar
2 eggs
2/3 cup dairy sour cream
1 tsp. vanilla
2 cups all-purpose flour, unsifted
1/2 cup Hershey's cocoa
1/2 tsp. baking soda
1/2 tsp. salt
12 oz. Hershey's mini chips
Cream shortening and sugar in large bowl. Add eggs, sour cream and vanilla. Beat well. Combine flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt. Blend into creamed mixture. Stir in mini chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until puffed and slightly cracked. Remove from cookie sheet. Cool on wire rack. Makes about six dozen cookies.
—Janet Johnson, Pennsburg
CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES
2/3 cup shortening (half butter or margarine)
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
1 egg
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. baking soda
1 1/2 cups Gold Medal flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1/2 cup chopped nuts
6 oz. pkg. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
Heat oven to 375 degrees. Mix shortening, sugars, egg, and vanilla thoroughly. Measure flour by dipping method or by sifting. Stir dry ingredients together, blend in. Mix in nuts and chocolate pieces. Drop each rounded teaspoonful about two inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until delicately browned. Cookies should be soft. Cool slightly before removing from baking sheet. Makes four to five dozen two-inch cookies.
Note: For a softer, rounded cookie, add 1/4 cup more flour.
How to measure flour by dipping: 1. Dip graduated measure cup into flour sack or canister. 2. Level off with spatula or straight-edged knife. Do not tap cup or pack more flour into cup before leveling off. 3. Pour flour into mixing bowl with other ingredients or stir flour and other ingredients together.
—Janet Johnson, Pennsburg
PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES
1/2 cup shortening (half butter or margarine)
1/2 cup peanut butter
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
1 egg
1 1/4 cups Gold Medal flour
1/2 tsp. baking powder
3/4 tsp. baking soda
1/4 tsp. salt
Mix shortening, peanut butter, sugars, and egg thoroughly. Measure flour by dipping method or by sifting. Blend all dry ingredients. Stir into shortening mixture. Heat oven to 375 degrees. Drop by round teaspoonful onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Flatten crisscross style with fork dipped in flour. Bake 10-12 minutes. Makes three dozen 2 1/2-inch cookies.
Note: To make Honey Peanut Butter Cookies, use above recipe but only use 1/4 cup shortening and add 1/2 cup honey in place of brown sugar.
How to measure flour by dipping: 1. Dip graduated measure cup into flour sack or canister. 2. Level off with spatula or straight-edged knife. Do not tap cup or pack more flour into cup before leveling off. 3. Pour flour into mixing bowl with other ingredients or stir flour and other ingredients together.
—Janet Johnson, Pennsburg
